Describe the bug An import problem, fresh install and it doesn't work. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Open a terminal and start Python 2. Import the library and get the error.
<denchmark-code>Python 2.7.15rc1 (default, Nov 12 2018, 14:31:15) [GCC 7.3.0] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import open3d Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/open3d/__init__.py", line 9, in <module> from open3d.linux import * ImportError: No module named linux >>> exit()
</denchmark-code>
Expected behavior Expected to import the library. Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Python version: 2.7 Open3D version: 0.3.0 Is this remote workstation?: no How did you install Open3D?: pip

comments.comment: Please install <denchmark-link:https://pypi.org/project/open3d-python/0.5.0.0/>open3d 0.5.0</denchmark-link> since version 0.3.0 is no longer supported. If there is an old version already installed, use pip install open3d-python -U to upgrade.
